author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to identify data that has been transferred across networks or systems. This includes implementing mechanisms to recognize and classify transferred data, ensuring that all data can be accurately identified and monitored. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, compliance with regulations, and enhancing overall security posture by providing visibility into data movement within the organization.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

fields.title: Data Type
fields.description: The type of data being transferred, such as personal information, financial records, or intellectual property.

fields.title: Transfer Method
fields.description: The method used for data transfer, such as email, file sharing services, or direct network transfers.

fields.title: Timestamp
fields.description: The date and time when the data transfer occurred.

fields.title: Source and Destination
fields.description: The systems or networks involved in the data transfer.

fields.title: Data Classification
fields.description: The classification of the data based on its sensitivity and importance.

fields.title: Transfer Size
fields.description: The size of the data being transferred, which can help in identifying large data movements.

automation.description: Automated tools to scan and identify transferred data based on predefined criteria.
Integration with data loss prevention (DLP) systems to monitor and classify transferred data in real-time.

title: Establish Ability to Identify Data Transferred

references.name: NIST SP 800-34 Rev. 1: Contingency Planning Guide for Federal Information Systems
SANS: Data Backup and Recovery Best Practices
CISA Data Backup Options and Strategies
